explains: n. 窥探者，私家侦探；窥探

sentences.en: The second house that Grossman had a snoop around contained "strong simple furniture."
sentences.cn: 格罗斯曼窥探过的第二所房子有“结实简朴的家具。”

sentences.en: He had a snoop around her office.
sentences.cn: 他在她的办公室窥探一番。

sentences.en: Governments have been known to snoop on and harass innocent citizens in the past.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，政府过去一直监视和侵扰无辜市民。
